results.title: Cyclone warning
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Brian McDuffie
results.brief_description: A dramatization of the action a community needs to take to prepare for a cyclone in Northern Queensland. Centres on three teenagers, one whose father works on the cyclone warning section of the Bureau of Meteorology. Real life experts in cyclone warnings take part in a critique of the actors’ roles at the end of the film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Brian McDuffie

results.title: Cyclo = Xich lo
results.creator_credit: Cristophe Rossignon, Lumière, Le Sept Cinema, La SFP Cinema and Tran Anh Hung
results.brief_description: This film depicts the bustle and brutality of urban life in modern Saigon, a city overrun by crime, violence, sex and madness. An 18 year old boy, nicknamed ‘Cyclo’, is trying to scrape together a living in the desperate poverty of Saigon, whilst living with his two sisters and grandfather. When his pedi-cab is stolen he is forced into the criminal underworld in order to repay his debt. Initially taking on small errands for a small group of thugs, he soon becomes entangled in far more sinister events. In Vetnamese with English subtitles. Cast includes: Tran Nu Yen-Khe, Le Van Loc and Tony Leung Chiu-Wai. (Awards: Flanders, 1995 and Venice, 1995)

results.title: Cycling: still the greatest
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jacques Bobet, Peter Katadotis and Gary Toole
results.brief_description: Scenes from the 1976 Olympics and the 1978 Commonwealth Games capture all the thrills and excitement of cycling. Featured are some of the world’s best cyclists and their coaches, in training and in competition. This fast-growing sport is attracting the attention of cyclists and spectators alike.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Jacques Bobet, Peter Katadotis and Gary Toole

results.title: Cyclic track maintenance
results.creator_credit: Harry Hauptmann, Victorian Railways Board and Ted Davis
results.brief_description: This film displays the regular maintenance by Victorian Railways’ track engineers to keep tracks up to standard. Interesting sequences of the special machines and equipment in use, testing and re-laying train tracks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Hauptmann, Victorian Railways Board and Ted Davis

results.title: Cycles of the sky
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
This episode examines the influence that the Moon and its orbit has on the earth and the phenomena of lunar and solar eclipses. By observing the phases of the moon, early astronomers were able to divide the calendar into months, and the Earth’s rotation around the sun was responsible for the measurement of time into seasons. The Moon’s two types of orbit, Siberial and Sinotic are explained. Outlines how the Moon affects tides by the gravitational pull it exerts. Although readily explained scientifically, the solar and lunar eclipses still fascinate astronomers, professional and amateur alike, with their beauty and wonder.

results.title: Cycle tour of Tasmania
results.brief_description: Captures the loneliness of the long distance cyclist. Covers one of the world’s most gruelling cycle races which circles the island. The aim of the film is to attract the premier amateur cycling countries to enter this event.

results.title: Cycle of progress
results.brief_description: Operations of the Alcoa Aluminium Company in Western Australia. The first bauxite mining operations commenced in 1963 at Jarrahdale, Western Australia. The bauxite is taken by rail to the refinery at Kwinana from where the alumina is shipped to the smelters at Point Henry, Victoria and to industry all over the world. The benefits to Australia as a whole from the establishment of one of the largest aluminium industries in the world are stated.

results.title: Cycle of life
results.creator_credit: Soil Association, Random Films and Peter Mills
results.brief_description: An analysis of past and present human folly in exploiting and destroying the vitality of the soil. The film commences with the story of the fall of ancient civilizations. To avoid the disasters of the past, humans, as an integral part of nature, must obey the laws of life. The film claims that husbandry, based on an awareness of our inseparable partnership with nature, leads to the promotion of health and vitality in soil, and so in plant, in animal and in humans thereby completing the “cycle of life”.

results.title: Cycle logic - cycle safety
results.creator_credit: Aerospace Audio-Visual Services and F M Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates safe operation and handling of motor-cycles. Shows how to start, clutch, brake and accelerate. Explains anticipation riding in entering intersections, taking curves, changing lanes, keeping safe distances and avoiding road hazards. Covers city, country road and freeway conditions. Also stresses the importance of protective clothing and good posture.

results.title: Cycle
results.creator_credit: Pierre Heberrt, ONF | NFB and Suzanne Gervais
results.brief_description: A film of free-hand line animation, where the movement as much as the designs reflects the artist’s thoughts on the life of humans and their universe. What evolves is a stream of ideas about the elemental situation of humankind, poised midway between the primary dust and the measureless universe yet unplumbed. A film without words; titles in French, music by Maurice Blackburn. (Award: San Francisco.)
